column4: ok, ive got a problem installing ubuntu, i burned it to a disc using nero, and when i put the disc in it comes up with a bunch of text, and the final line says "[DR-DOS]  A:\>" what do i do now?
I just downloaded Ubuntu, and whenever i start up mycomputer, it comes up with a bunch of text, then the final line says "[DR-DOS]  A:\>" then it wants me to type something, what do i do?
are you booting from the cd?
go into your bios and make sure booting from cd is first in the sequence
well, type "help" in the dos prompt and see if you can boot from cd from within it
A friend of mine had the same problem. I can't remember what he did but he got it to work eventually
I don't think it's an issue with the disk
you probably have a dos os flashed into your bios or something
play around with your bios i guess?
try googling "dr dos bios" or something
if you don't have a floppy and it's not booting from the hd it's probably the vendor's bios doing it
yeah, the bios the mobo manufacturer loaded
did you try typing "help" at the dos prompt?
hm, strange. i don't know, my friend isn't online right now to ask what he did, but he had the same "dr dos" thing
